mention.text: Sen. John L. McClellan -LRB- D. , Ark. -RRB-
the jurisdiction of the Supreme Court
a case on practically any issue
delegate to Congress from the District of Columbia
the Marshall hearings that have a bearing on Judge Thomas 's case
a man to be associate justice of the Supreme Court only if his views always coincide with our own
the president of the United States
his desire to appoint someone he considers a liberal
Committee Chairman James Eastland -LRB- D. , Miss. -RRB-
The fact that Mr. Thomas 's judicial views are not the same as those of Thurgood Marshall
a reflection of the increasingly pluralistic nature of black society , but hardly an issue worthy of senatorial consideration
